other_tests.findings: The pituitary gland of both boys revealed diffuse mammosomatotroph hyperplasia of the entire pituitary gland without evidence of adenoma. Prolactin and GH were secreted by the same cells within the same secretory granules.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After surgery, both morning GH and PRL rapidly decreased to low normal levels by the first postoperative day. IGF-I reached normal, age-adjusted levels by postoperative day 3.

other_tests.findings: There was stimulation of PRL and GH by TRH. GH failed to suppress during an oral glucose suppression test.
An exaggerated insulin response was observed and GH levels increased significantly during hypoglycemia.
Elevated random serum GH and prolactin levels were observed in both boys.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Post-surgery assessment revealed that both boys had normalized hormone levels.
